quotes.author: Billy Connolly
quotes.body: Before you judge a man, walk a mile in his shoes. After that who cares?... He’s a mile away and you’ve got his shoes!

quotes.author: Jeff Sickel
quotes.body: Deleted code is debugged code.

quotes.author: Ken Thompson
quotes.body: When in doubt, use brute force.

quotes.author: Donald Knuth
quotes.body: We should forget about small efficiencies, say about 97% of the time: premature optimization is the root of all evil. Yet we should not pass up our opportunities in that critical 3%.

quotes.author: Fred Brooks
quotes.body: What one programmer can do in one month, two programmers can do in two months.

quotes.author: Poul Anderson
quotes.body: I have yet to see any problem, however complicated, which when looked at in the right way, did not become more complicated.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.body: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.

quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
quotes.body: Testing can be a very effective way to show the presence of bugs, but it is hopelessly inadequate for showing their absence.

quotes.author: Henri Petroski
quotes.body: The most amazing achievement of the computer software industry is its continuing cancellation of the steady and staggering gains made by the computer hardware industry.

quotes.author: Linus Torvalds
quotes.body: I'm doing a free operating system (just a hobby, won't be big and professional like GNU).
There is no try.
quotes.author: Yoda

quotes.body: One cannot and must not try to erase the past merely because it does not fit the present.
quotes.author: Golda Meir

quotes.body: I know I am getting better at golf because I am hitting fewer spectators.
quotes.author: Gerald Ford

quotes.body: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.body: A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.body: An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.body: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies; for the hardest victory is over self.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.body: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.
quotes.author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

quotes.body: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.body: I have no special talents. I am only passionately curious.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.body: Any society that would give up a little liberty to gain a little security will deserve neither and lose both.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.body: Only the educated are free.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.body: Sometimes I think the surest sign that intelligent life exists elsewhere in the universe is that none of it has tried to contact us.
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.body: You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams.
quotes.author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

quotes.body: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
quotes.author: Samuel Langhorne Clemens

quotes.body: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.body: The life which is unexamined is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.body: To accomplish great things, we must dream as well as act.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.body: Try not to become a man of success but rather to become a man of value.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.body: We cannot learn without pain.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.body: Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.body: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.body: You could not prevent a thunderstorm, but you could use the electricity; you could not direct the wind, but you could trim your sail so as to propel your vessel as you pleased, no matter which way the wind blew.
quotes.author: Cora L. V. Scott

quotes.body: There are only two ways to live your life: as though nothing is a miracle, or as though everything is a miracle.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
